title: Sam and Olivia's Song Climbs to Number One After a Long Wait
summary: Sam Fender and Olivia Dean have made history in the UK music charts. Their song, Rein Me In, reached number one after 35 weeks, which is the longest time any song has spent in the top 40 before becoming number one. The song is a duet about a relationship ending and was first released last June. It had been at number five three times before finally reaching the top. Sam said the song took a long time to become popular because people discovered it online over time. Olivia added a new verse from a female perspective, making the song better. They performed it together at big stadiums in London and Newcastle. This is Sam's first number one single, while Olivia has had other hits. The song replaced Taylor Swift's Opalite at number one.

background_read: This article is about music charts in the UK, which rank songs based on how many people listen to or buy them. Songs can take a long time to become popular, especially with the internet helping them spread slowly. A duet is when two singers perform together, often telling a story from different sides. Breaking a record means doing something better than anyone has before, like spending the most weeks in the chart before reaching number one. Performing at stadiums shows that the song is loved by many fans.
